title: India Sets Green Hydrogen and Ammonia Consumption Targets for Industries
summary: India's government announced new consumption targets for green hydrogen and ammonia across select industries as part of its green energy policy. The initiative includes a significant incentive plan to promote clean energy adoption.
content:
India has established mandatory consumption targets for green hydrogen and ammonia across specific industrial sectors as part of its broader push toward clean energy alternatives. The government unveiled these targets alongside its comprehensive green energy policy.

In a significant move announced from New Delhi, the administration approved an incentive plan worth 174.9 billion rupees to accelerate the adoption of green hydrogen and ammonia in the country's industrial operations.

The policy aims to create sustained demand for these clean energy sources while helping India reduce its carbon footprint and meet its climate commitments.

## Policy Overview

India has established mandatory consumption targets for green hydrogen and ammonia across specific industrial sectors as part of its broader push toward clean energy alternatives. The government unveiled these targets alongside its comprehensive green energy policy.

In a significant move announced from New Delhi, the administration approved an incentive plan worth 174.9 billion rupees to accelerate the adoption of green hydrogen and ammonia in the country's industrial operations.

The policy aims to create sustained demand for these clean energy sources while helping India reduce its carbon footprint and meet its climate commitments.
